microstructure: single phase, fully recrystallized with a slight texture along the normal direction
evidence: The HfNbTaTiZr RHEA was produced by arc melting and was subsequently homogenized, cold-rolled at room temperature, and recrystallized. This process yielded a single-phase disordered BCC alloy with grains slightly smaller along the normal direction of the rolled sheets (aspect ratio of ~1.3) and a mean grain size of ~70 mm. The elastic moduli of this HfNbTaTiZr RHEA were measured between 293 K and 1100 K using a resonance frequency technique.

microstructure: Fully recrystallized, equiaxed grains in the (RD,TD) plane with a slight texture. <111> directions of the grains parallel to the normal direction of the sheet (g-fiber) and <110> along the rolling one (a-fiber).
processing_method: Cold rolling followed by annealing at 1373 K for 5 h
evidence: The microstructure and texture of the B23 sheet were analysed by EBSD using a longitudinal section as well as a cross-section. A fully recrystallized microstructure is achieved after cold rolling followed by annealing at 1373 K for 5 h as shown. The grains are equiaxed in the (RD,TD) plane and the average grain size is about 80 mm. A slight texture is evidenced after coldrolling and subsequent recrystallization with <111> directions of the grains parallel to the normal direction of the sheet (g-fiber) and <110> along the rolling one (a-fiber).

microstructure: single-phase BCC solid solution with equiaxed grains and a nearly random texture
processing_method: arc-melting, homogenized, cold rolled, and recrystallized at 1373 K for 5 h
evidence: An equiatomic HfNbTaTiZr high-entropy alloy was produced by arc-melting. The cast ingots were homogenized, cold rolled, and recrystallized at 1373 K for 5 h. After recrystallization, the alloy was found to be a single-phase BCC solid solution with equiaxed grains and a nearly random texture.
At room temperature (300 K), the elastic moduli of the polycrystalline HfNbTaTiZr RHEA are: G ¼ 35.8 GPa, E ¼ 90 GPa, B ¼ 62 GPa, and n ¼ 0.26;
